data.title: Prince of Persia: The Sands of Time Remake hits "important internal milestone"
data.meta_description: Ubisoft has provided a brief update on the embattled Prince of Persia: The Sand of Time Remake, confirming that the game is still on the way.
data.text:
Ubisoft has provided a brief update on the embattled Prince of Persia: The Sand of Time Remake, confirming that the game is still on the way.

Sean Carey

Published 22 Nov 2023

Followtopics

Xbox Series X|SSean Carey

In a post celebrating the 20th anniversary of the original game, Ubisoft shared that development on the long-delayed Prince of Persia: The Sands of Time Remake is progressing well and recently hit an internal milestone.

Prince of Persia: The Sands of Time Remake was originally down to launch in 2021, but after several delays, a new developer, and a reboot back to the conception stage, the game has yet to materialize. However, after a period of silence, Ubisoft now says that the remake "has passed an important internal milestone and development is progressing."

While a release window for the remake remains a mystery, a new Prince of Persia game is coming early next year. Prince of Persia: The Lost Crown is a new action-adventure platformer from Ubisoft that is "inspired by the Metroidvania structure" and launches for Xbox Series X|S and Xbox One on January 18.

Written by Sean Carey
